intro: Paraboea ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty paraboea, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, oval berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
